sen.j: 鰻重（うなじゅう，うな重）とは、一般には木製の四角い箱に漆塗り等の塗りをかけた蓋の付いた食器である重箱の中に御飯を入れウナギの蒲焼を載せ、上から蒲焼のタレをかけた日本料理の一つ、又は鰻料理を入れる食器の名称。
sen.e: The term "Unaju" refers to a Japanese dish which contains broiled eel on rice with sauce in Jubako (generally tiered square wooden boxes with a cover which is coated by urushi Japanese lacquer) or refers to a specific kind of plateware used to serve broiled eel.

The term "Unaju" refers to a Japanese dish which contains broiled eel on rice with sauce in Jubako (generally tiered square wooden boxes with a cover which is coated by urushi Japanese lacquer) or refers to a specific kind of plateware used to serve broiled eel.

The terms "Unaju" (written as 鰻重, うなじゅう, うな重) refer to a Japanese dish, which contains broiled eel on rice with sauce in Jubako (generally tiered square wooden boxes with a cover which is coated by urushi Japanese lacquer) or refers to a specific kind of container used to serve broiled eel.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: いずれも鰻重箱（うなぎじゅうばこ）の略称である。
sen.e: Any of them are the abbreviation of unagi (eel) Jubako.
Any of these terms are an abbreviation of unagi (eel) Jubako.
Any of these terms are an abbreviation of unagi Jubako.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 近年では、ABS樹脂を用いて成形した上に化学塗料を塗った重箱を使用した鰻重も多い。
sen.e: Recently many unaju use the Jubako which is made of acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene resin and coated with chemical paint.
Recently many unaju use the Jubako which is made of acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene resin and coated with chemical paint.
Recently many unaju use the Jubako that is made of acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene resin and coated with chemical coating.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 用いる食器が丼であれば鰻丼、重箱なら鰻重とする地域もある。
sen.e: In some regions, a bowl of rice topped with eel is called Unadon while rice topped with eel in Jubako is called Unaju.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In some regions, a bowl of rice topped with eel is called Unadon while rice topped with eel in Jubako is called Unaju.
In some regions, a bowl of rice topped with eel is called Unadon while rice topped with eel in Jubako is called Unaju.

sen.j: 鰻重とは鰻が重なった状態の鰻重ね（うながさね）を意味するとして、御飯と鰻の蒲焼をサンドイッチ状（＝挟む）にし表面の鰻の下のご飯の下に更に蒲焼が入った合計二匹分の蒲焼が入ったものを鰻重と呼ぶ地域や店舗がある。
sen.e: In other regions and restaurants, considering the word Unaju means the compiling of eel, the rice topped with two broiled eels, that is, one eel is put on the surface of the rice and the other eel is put under the rice, is called Unaju.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In other regions and restaurants, where the word Unaju means stacking eel, rice topped with two broiled eels, that is, one eel is put on the surface of the rice and the other eel placed under the rice, is called Unaju.

In other regions and restaurants, where the word Unaju means overlapped eel, rice sandwiched in between two broiled eels, that is, one eel is put on the surface of the rice and the other eel placed under the rice, is called Unaju.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 漢方薬で消化を助けるサンショウの実を乾燥させた後に石臼等で挽いた山椒の粉を振りかけ香味を楽しみながら重箱の左隅から食べるのが一般的な作法である。
sen.e: It is a general manner to begin to eat from the left corner with putting Japanese pepper powder, which is considered to enhance digestion in Chinese medicine and is dried and milled by a stone mill, and enjoying its flavor.

Generally, Unaju is consumed from the left corner by applying Japanese pepper powder, which is considered to enhance digestion in Chinese medicine and is dried and milled by a stone mill, in order to enjoy its flavor.

Generally, Unaju is consumed from the left corner by applying Sansho (Japanese pepper powder), which is considered to enhance digestion in Chinese medicine, which is dried and milled by a stone mill, in order to enhance the flavor.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 「山椒は小粒でもぴりりと辛い」の喩えの通り、舌先が痺れるほど大量に粉を振りかけるのは無作法とされる。
sen.e: As a proverb that 'even small Japanese pepper is piquant,' says, it is considered to be rude to put on as much powders as the tongue becoming numb.
As a proverb that 'even small Japanese pepper is piquant,' says, it is considered to be rude to put consumate amounts of powder causing the tongue to become numb.
A proverb says, 'even small Japanese pepper is piquant,' and it is considered rude to put consummate amounts of powder, which can numb the taste buds.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一般に肝吸いと共に食べることが多い。
sen.e: Generally it is often eaten with eel liver soup.
Generally it is often eaten with eel liver soup.
Generally it is often served with eel liver soup.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 大抵の鰻重は高い順にマツ・竹・ウメ等の序列でコースが分かれている。
sen.e: Most of Unaju are ranked in the line from pine, bamboo to plum trees.
Most Unaju are ranked using the terms of pine, bamboo and plum trees in order of highest quality.
Most Unaju are ranked using the terms of pine, bamboo and plum trees in the order of price.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 鰻重単体で比較した場合、鰻の個体差により若干の差が生じるが鰻の大きさによってランク付けする場合、半身か一匹かで分ける場合、ウナギが天然か養殖かでランク付けする場合などがある。
sen.e: There are various standards of the ranking; in the comparison on the Unaju itself, there are the ranking by the size of eel although there is a little difference among individual eel, the one by half or whole, the one by natural eel or farmed product.

Ranking varies; in comparing the Unaju itself, ranking compares the size of eel although there is little difference among individual eels. Rather they are ranked according to whether they are half or whole, wild or farmed.

Ranking varies; in comparing the Unaju itself, ranks are based on the size of eel although there is a slight difference among individual eels; the ranks are also determined factors including whether the eel is served half or whole, and whether the eel is wild or farmed.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ほかにも、前記のような鰻重ねとして二匹分入っている場合、一匹の場合、前記鰻重ねで下層の蒲焼が一匹丸々入っている場合、器に入れる際に大きさを整えるために切り落とした切れ端も含めてひつまぶし同様に蒲焼を細かく刻んだものが敷かれている場合、など様々なランク付けがある。
sen.e: When two eels are compiled as mentioned above, there are various ranking such as the case when one whole eel is put on for an under layer and the one when a small chopped broiled eel is put including the edges which are cut off in order to cut an eel in evenly sized pieces when it is put into a plateware like Hitsumabushi (Nagoya style Eel on Rice).

When two eels are compiled as mentioned above, there are various ranking such as the case when one whole eel is used for the lowerr layer and one when a small chopped broiled eel is placed in a bowl in evenly sized pieces where the edges are cut off in order to cut the eel in evenly sized pieces, such as Hitsumabushi (Nagoya style Eel on Rice).

Various factors are taken into account in this ranking system: whether two eels are arranged as described above or only one eel is used; and whether a whole eel is placed at the bottom layer when two eels are arranged as described above or a chopped broiled eel is placed at the bottom layer with, just like the Hitsumabushi (Nagoya style Eel on Rice), the edges which are cut off in order to cut the eel into evenly sized pieces included.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 鰻料理は注文を受けてから調理を始めることが多く、鰻重も同様であり急ぎの食事には適さない。
sen.e: Broiled eel is often begun to cook after an order as well as Unaju, which is not adequate to a meal which should be eaten up quickly.
Since broiled eel is often cooked after an order has been placed, it is not a meal to be consumed when one is in a hurry.
Since broiled eel is often cooked after an order has been placed, it is not a meal to be consumed when one is in a hurry.

sen.j: 時に注文を受けてから御飯を炊き始める鰻屋も有る。
sen.e: Some broiled eel restaurants began to cook rice after an order.
Some broiled eel restaurants begin to cook the rice after an order has been placed.
Some broiled eel restaurants begin to cook the rice after an order has been placed.

sen.j: 鱗のない魚は総じて皮が厚く、鰻も例外ではない（ナマズなどとは違いきわめて小さな鱗があるが皮膚に埋没している）。
sen.e: An esquamate fish generally has a thick skin including eel (unlike a catfish, it has a very small squama which is hidden in the skin).
An esquamate fish generally has a thick skin including eel (unlike a catfish, it has a very small squama which is hidden in the skin).
An esquamate fish including eel generally has a thick skin (unlike a catfish, eel has a very small squama which is hidden in the skin).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 川や沼等に生息する天然産のウナギは養殖や輸入した物に比べて蒸した後に蒲焼にしても弾力があり、噛むほどに滋味を愉しめるほどの歯ごたえがある。
sen.e: A natural eel which lives in a river or pond is more elastic than a farmed eel or imported eel even broiled after steamed, and it is as tough as being able to enjoy its nutritious through chewing.
A natural eel which lives in a river or pond is more elastic than a farmed or imported eel even after being broiled after being steamed, and its taste more enjoyable due to its chewable nature.
A natural eel which lives in a river or pond is more elastic than a farmed or imported eel even after being steamed and broiled, and its taste more enjoyable due to its chewable nature.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その一方で一般に出回っている養殖ウナギのように箸先でほぐすことを期待しても切れないことがあり、直接蒲焼を口に運んで食いちぎらなければならないほどである。
sen.e: On the other hand, some natural eels can not be cut by chopsticks like a common farmed eel and have to be bitten off with one's teeth.
On the other hand, some natural eels can not be cut by chopsticks such as the common farmed eel and have to be bitten off with one's teeth.
On the other hand, some natural eels cannot be cut by chopsticks as the usual farmed eel so that they have to be bitten off with one's teeth.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 鰻重を好んで食べる有名人としては棋士の加藤一二三九段が挙げられる。
sen.e: Hifumi KATO, a Kishi (professional go or shogi player) with nine dan (ninth grade), is famous for his preference for Unaju.
Hifumi KATO, a Kishi (professional go or shogi player) with nine dan (ninth grade), is famous for his preference for Unaju.
Hifumi KATO, a Kishi (professional shogi player) with nine dan (ninth grade), is famous for his preference for Unaju.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 対局中の食事として必ず鰻重をとるほどであり、左右のポケットには昼夕の代金2100円ずつが入っているという。
sen.e: He likes it as much as he definitely eats Unaju for a meal during playing a game, and it is said that he has each 2,100 yen for lunch and dinner in the left and right pocket.
He likes it so much that he eats Unaju when he plays a game, and it is said that he has 2,100 yen for lunch and dinner in both his left and right pocket.
He likes it so much that he eats Unaju when he plays a game, and it is said that he has 2,100 yen for Unaju for lunch and dinner in each of his left and right pockets.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
